ruling_link_text: The president can't; only states can
statement_context: an interview with World Net Daily
statement: "The president … by executive order" could grant voting rights to illegal immigrants who are newly legalized under pending legislation.

ruling_link_text: None of those things

statement: The IRS is going to be "in charge" of "a huge national database" on health care that will include Americans’ "personal, intimate, most close-to-the-vest-secrets."

ruling_link_text: IRS role hardly puts it "in charge"
statement_context: an interview on Fox News' "On the Record" with Greta Van Susteren
statement: The IRS is "going to be in charge of our health care."
ruling_headline: Michele Bachmann says the IRS is "going to be in charge of our health care"

ruling_link_text: Maybe to delay health insurance
statement_context: an interview on Fox News' "On the Record" with Greta Van Susteren
statement: "The IRS will have the ability potentially" to deny or delay health care.

ruling_link_text: Scientists tell us this is nonsense
statement_context: a speech at CPAC
statement: "Scientists tell us that we could have a cure in 10 years for Alzheimer's" were it not for "overzealous regulators, excessive taxation and greedy litigators."
ruling_headline: Michele Bachmann says Alzheimer's disease could be cured if not for government regulation, taxes and lawyers

ruling_link_text: Overhead is 5 percent at most, not 70 percent
statement_context: a speech at the conservative CPAC conference
statement: Of every "three dollars in food stamps for the needy, seven dollars in salaries and pensions (go to) the bureaucrats who are supposed to be taking care of the poor."
ruling_headline: Michele Bachmann says 70 percent of food stamp funding goes to 'bureaucrats'

ruling_link_text: Actually shows rate could drop under Obama
statement_context: a Fox News interview
statement: "A report just came out that if we continue with President Obama's policies, we're looking at over 9 percent unemployment next year in the fourth quarter."
ruling_headline: Rep. Michele Bachmann claims report says the president's policies will drive up unemployment

ruling_link_text: True, with one caveat
statement_context: a Republican presidential primary debate
statement: Says Newt Gingrich "made an affirmative statement that he would not only support but he would campaign for Republicans who were in support of the barbaric procedure known as partial-birth abortion."
ruling_headline: Michele Bachmann claims Newt Gingrich promised support for abortion proponents

ruling_link_text: Uh, except for that Pants on Fire...
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Sioux City, Iowa
statement: "After the debate that we had last week, PolitiFact came out and said that everything I said was true."
ruling_headline: Michele Bachmann says "PolitiFact came out and said that everything I said was true" in last debate

ruling_link_text: Nearly the opposite
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Iowa
statement: Says Mitt Romney, as governor of Massachusetts, "put into place socialized medicine."
ruling_headline: Michele Bachmann says former Mass. Gov. Mitt Romney 'put into place socialized medicine'

ruling_link_text: A requirement to purchase -- or post a bond
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Des Moines, Iowa
statement: In 1993, Newt Gingrich "first advocated for the individual mandate in health care. And as recently as May of this year, he was still advocating" for it.
ruling_headline: Michele Bachmann says Newt Gingrich backed individual mandate in 1993, 2011

ruling_link_text: Ahmadinejad says he doesn't want to build a nuke
statement_context: a foreign policy debate in Washington, D.C.
statement: Says Mahmoud Ahmadinejad said that "if he has a nuclear weapon he will use it to wipe Israel off the face of the earth. He will use it against the United States of America."
ruling_headline: Michele Bachmann says Iran has threatened to launch nuclear attack against Israel, United States

ruling_link_text: Jobs was blunt with everyone -- including Obama
statement_context: a Republican debate in Washington
statement: Says Apple CEO Steve Jobs told President Obama that the company moved factories to China because it needed 30,000 engineers.
ruling_headline: Michele Bachmann says Steve Jobs told Obama he moved factories to China for engineers

ruling_link_text: Currently, it's less than a quarter
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Michigan
statement: "By 2015, we will be sending so much interest" to China that "we will be paying for the entire People's Liberation Army."
ruling_headline: Michele Bachmann says U.S. will soon send enough interest to China to pay for their military

ruling_link_text: Most of that was under Bush, not Obama
statement_context: an interview with CNN's Wolf Blitzer
statement: "Under Barack Obama's watch, we have expended $805 billion to liberate the people of Iraq and, more importantly, 4,400 American lives."

ruling_link_text: One is; one isn't
statement_context: a Republican presidential primary debate
statement: President Obama’s uncle and aunt "are illegal aliens ...  who've been allowed to stay in this country."
ruling_headline: Michele Bachmann links Obama relatives to immigration policy

ruling_link_text: Sustainability, not unpopularity, did it in
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Las Vegas
statement: "Obamacare is so flat-out unpopular, that even the Obama administration chose to reject part of Obamacare last Friday, when they tried to throw out the CLASS Act, which is the long-term care function."

ruling_link_text: Four has been the consistent minimum since 1993

statement: "We saw the president of the United States engage American troops in a fourth conflict in a foreign land. This is historic."

ruling_link_text: The former federal tax attorney is right

statement: "When we got the income tax in 1913, the top rate was 7 percent. By 1980, the top rate was 70 percent."

ruling_link_text: Bachmann has her cents straight

statement: "Our government right now. . . (is) spending 40 percent more than what we take in."

statement: "President Obama has the lowest public approval ratings of any president in modern times."

ruling_link_text: The 'I heard it somewhere' standard of evidence

statement: Says Tim Pawlenty said in 2006, "The era of small government is over... the government has to be more proactive and more aggressive."

ruling_link_text: Financial disclosures say otherwise

statement: "My husband and I have never gotten a penny of money from the farm."

ruling_link_text: A frequent talking point with a strong basis in reality
statement_context: several speeches and interviews
statement: Says President Barack Obama said that if he doesn’t turn the economy around after three years in office, he’ll be a one-term president.

ruling_link_text: About 4 percent, not "all"
